content.raw:
I like it how the follow offset is adjusted as the user orbits the scene, really intuitive! Just a few comments below:

* While following a model, clicking `Move To` for another model makes the camera jump to the new model and then back to the old one. Can we disable `Move To` while `Follow` is running?

* I think the current parameters work well for mobile robots, but they can be a bit dizzying when used with objects that are rapidly changing their orientation, such as below. Setting the P gain to zero makes that situation much better. Do you think you could expose the P gain through the plugin's SDF? I think this could be handy for tracking non-robot objects.

    P gain == 0.01

    ![dizzy_box.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/295606903-dizzy_box.gif)

    P gain == 0

    ![zero_gain_box.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1911577059-zero_gain_box.gif)

* Do you think it would be much more work to support choosing a visual to be tracked at startup through SDF? I think the logic should support the model being spawned at any time.
